comments.commentBody:
"Morgerm morgen nur nicht heute!" Sagen alles faulen Leute.

The eurocrats have come back down from Mount Olympus with a "plan" to kick the euro can down the road yet another time, rather than face up to the fact that the euro and the European Union are doomed to fail. The longer they wait, the worse the outcome will be. Now Greece. Then it will be Italy, Spain, Portuagal... The Germans taxpayers had better get a pile of those euro things handy. Brussels is going to need them soon.

We have to give Europe for getting things done and setting its economy in the generally right direction to repair its economic quagmire. The same cannot be really said without cringing to the United States...

Most intelligent people should realize these Globalist bankers are some of the most untrustworthy thugs on the face of the earth!

I don't know what is wrong with these European people, that they even allow any of these rigged negotiations to take place!
What deal can be negotiated with a Globalist who plans to cull the human population down to 550 Million from 7 billion?

It was proven to the world what absolute crooks these people are when they tried to negotiate Iceland into an incredible debt - that when the books were finally opened up - it was found that most of this debt over 90% was all Bankers debt, that the bankers tried to have Iceland sign on to!

They did not and the people told the bankers to go to hell and kicked them out of Iceland in the face of the fraud the banksters tried to enslave Iceland with!

This is what they are doing to Greece, Germany and all of Europe!
How is it that this farce is adhered to and the people allow themselves to be fleeced?
If you want a life at all, it is time to stand up and like Iceland tell these crooks to go to hell!

There is absolutely no point in negotiating anything with a crook!

The world needs to stand together regardless of balkinization and ride these few Oligarchs out on a rail! I can't believe there are that many gutless people all over the world!

We've nothing to lose, under the Globalists' tyranny, there will be no life to be lived by human kind anyway!
How can these countries default before unloading their gold reserves.  Greece, Portugal, Spain and Italy need to unload their gold reserves first.

The sort of thing Chancellor Merkel did is what both the Bush and Obama administrations should have done in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis in the US, force the heavily leveraged US financial institutions to take a loss on their bonds, credit default swaps, and other assorted derivative instruments.  Instead, they were able to frighten, manipulate, and/or bribe the government to come to their rescue to ensure their would be no write down on their risky, high yielding investments, such as Goldman Sachs getting around 13 billion from AIG as payment for their default swaps after the collapsing AIG received an infusion of tens of billions of dollars from the US Treasury. And, all the while the US public was pitched the story that unless all these financial institutions were not required to take any loss on these assets, we were all doomed.

Bravo to Merkel for standing up to the banks even after Geithner tried to strong-arm her into caving in.  We Americans should however be asking why Geithner is still running the Treasury Department.  He, and by extension his boss longer even pretends to care about American workers; their true allegiance is now openly to the bankers bankrolling the re-election campaign.
Too bad Obama can't/won't similarly call the "bankers' bluffs"

"In the end, it was Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and President Nicolas Sarkozy of France against the European banking establishment — and the bankers blinked."

In America, it would've been the other way around, as all branches of the US Governement have been co-opted or subsumed by the monied interests.

"Ah, the cradle of democracy, the casket of capitalism."

Note to the poster of the above: Capitalism, as currently practiced, is anything but. It deserves nothing but the casket.

I suppose the various economies feel they need the banks to function, so that's why the governments are picking up half the losses that by some rights belong 100% to the bankers who made their bets and would have been quite willing to keep all their winnings. So paying back to the banks half of what they lost on their bets now seems painful to the banks.

when I lose a bet I get to own all the loss. What's wrong with this picture?
Why can't print  more Euros like our prints Dollars?

I havea solution for the Euro crisis. Let them print more Euros; like our FED printed more dollars.Give the all the new Euros to Greek banks which would pay off their loans to the German banks.If this scheme succeeds they can repeat this plan in Italy Spain and Ireland.
Now we need strong leaders in the USA so the banksters blink.

If I hadn't read [the misleading] headline, I would have believed something great was achieved. Instead, little was achieved. If something's voluntary, the offerer can withdraw the offer, right? This is all talk, no substance. By the way, it doesn't mention that American tax money funds by far the biggest chunk of the corrupt IMF, and IMF money is OUR money. WE are bailing out Greece and the rest of Europe. I object. If our banks face exposure, let them take a write-down. We already bailed them out. Is there no end to fleecing the American taxpayer? Merkel's plan to demand China and other countries with "cash surpluses" is laughable. Russia was mentioned. Does Russia have a surplus? If so, it's because it lets millions live like animals, in disgusting poverty, while Putin flaunts his pectorals.

Vague invitations for voluntary losses financed by private interests on the backs of the poor and middle class all guaranteed by  thinly veiled credit default swaps. Are you sure this isn't a Republican plan ? I will short the Euro around 1.4225. No one ever went broke betting on human stupidity.

Merkel for President (of the U.S.). Wow, can you imagine a President that makes big banks blink, or even knows how to not blink in tough negoiation. Never heard of such a thing over here. Obama walks in the room blinking away in eager anticipation of giving in!

Write in Merkel in 2012!

Time Warner has an app for Ipad, I assume the Apple Tv (box) does as well. Why not trial the voice control for viewing on the Ipad. Who needs a big screen, when the screen is in your hand. Same thing with Apple large monitors, which already have greater than HDTV resolution, and only need a device to direct tv to their screen..
Wow - the reactions posted here are decidedly mixed.  So much for "crowd-sourcing."

Haven't used or bought an HP in years, and neither has anyone I know. The first few comments on this blog sound like astro-turfing PR. HP stiffed me out of a $50 rebate, and that was the last straw. You steal my money then you get no more from me (I even wrote to Mark Hurd about this and only got back a canned PR response). My family used to all use HP laptops but they would invariably break down after two years of light use. HP all-in-one printers would also break down in a couple years.

For the all-in-one, I switched to Canon, and have used it with no problems for five years. For laptops, I switched to Apple and couldn't be happier. HP is simply irrelevant (along with Dell), and with eBay disaster Whitman in charge, HP will end up on the scrap bin of silicon history so enough.
Bone-headed move by Whitman.  HP's PC business is already tanking irretrievably due to the cost-cutting under Heard . Glad I shorted the stock!

If Siri's response to statements like:

You: “Testing, 1, 2, 3.” Siri: “Is this thing on?”

You: “I love you, Siri.” Siri: “You are the wind beneath my wings.”

You: “Open the pod bay doors, Hal.” Siri: “I’m sorry, Dave, I can’t do that. Happy now?”

is always the same "hilarious, sassy" response, then isn't that exactly the opposite of going "off-script"?

Why is it that we cannot choose between a male and a female voice? This is already bothersome enough in all the GPS systems out there.
In the old days, Panasonic offered their digital answering machines in a male and a female version.
I hope that eventually, we may choose to bestow anyone's voice onto our devices, from Grandma to Obama.

My personal favorite would be Morgan Freeman, though.

Clearly, the message in this article is mixed -- a positive report with multiple qualifications. But suppose it were all unequivocally positive. The country is pulling out of the recession -- period. There are few warning signals at home or abroad. Every economist in the world agrees that things are getting better fast.

I wonder how people like Mitch McConnell, Eric Cantor, Paul Ryan, and Grover Norquist would feel about that.

Tony is this year's recipient of the Ron Gardenhire Award for managers who get it done season after season, but go into unremitting sphincter spasm in the post-season.  Here's to you, Tony!  You're GRRRRRRRREAAAAAATTTT!

Im an independent and vote D most of the time.....But have disdain for the labor unions. They did good work decades ago...But they are in the same group of people as the bankers and other whose greed is ruining our great country. Look at the recent police and socail service exposes in this newspaper....Union employees.
Now they have joined up with the Occupy Wall Street. Cant get anyone to attend their events so the hijack the one getting alll the attention. Why? Millions in potential new forced union dues...You wonder why less than 8% of the private sector is union, and 35% of the state and federal and public workers are, and its growing...100% paid everything, full pension after 20 years, nice disability plans....
